subject: Music
title: The Road Crew: Unsung Heroes
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on The Road Crew: Unsung Heroes.

hook.text: A BeyoncÃ© stadium show needs 200+ crew working 18-hour days. Fans never see them.

buildup.text: Roadies, sound engineers, lighting techs, riggers, and drivers form the backbone of every tour.

discovery.text: Crew work 70-80 hour weeks in season. A touring sound engineer earns $2K-$5K per week, no benefits.

twist.text: COVID wiped out 12 million crew jobs overnight. Most had zero savings because the industry offered none.

climax.text: Post-pandemic, many experienced crew left forever. A severe worker shortage now strains every tour.

punchline.text: The crew makes the magic. The artist takes the bow.

quiz.question: What major crisis did concert crew workers face in 2020?
options: A global strike for better wages
Mass income loss when COVID shut down live music
